result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Case called at 1:36 PM 
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daryl A. Bates in court by zoom with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Defense enters a not guilty plea to Count 2.
Defense is waiting for additional discovery and requests another date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:15 AM Defendant Daryl A. Bates in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer.

Adjustment Number: 22A 007657,
Payable Number: 459177,
Receipt Number: 22R 008571,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on March 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Court orders CAM monitoring pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

01:22 PM Defendant Daryl A. Bates in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Attorney appears as friend of the court. Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Based upon colloquy with Attorney Griffis, it is likely defendant will not qualify for their services or qualify for a Court appointed attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
